New Records: Houston Astros beat Kansas City Royals 6-3 with key errors in the 8th inning
Zach Dezenzo drew a go-ahead bases-loaded walk
Ryan Pressly earned his 1st win since activation from injured list
Key Match Events: Astros scored 4 runs in the 8th inning due to two errors
José Altuve scored from second on a bobbled throw
Jeremy Peña grounded into a force out
Mauricio Dubón followed with a single to left field
John Schreiber intentionally walked Ben Gamel
Alex Bregman was ejected in the 4th inning
Pre-Game Insights: Astros starter Hunter Brown pitched 6 2/3 innings without earned runs
Jason Heyward made a two-run double in his Astros debut
Royals starter Brady Singer allowed 5 hits and 2 runs
Bobby Witt Jr. went 0 for 4 after a 16-game hitting streak
Post-Match Reflections: Astros manager Joe Espada spoke about Kyle Tucker's progress
Royals manager Matt Quatraro updated on Hunter Renfroe's injury
Ryan Pressly secured his 29th save of the season
Josh Hader pitched a perfect ninth
Miscellaneous Highlights: Astros activated Ryan Pressly from the injured list
Astros third baseman Alex Bregman was ejected
Royals shortstop Bobby Witt Jr. ended his streak
Astros RF Kyle Tucker is recovering from a shin contusion
Royals RF Hunter Renfroe is recovering from a hamstring strain
